property.name: label
property.label: Flow Selector Label
property.description: Set the text to appear above the Flow selection box

property.name: placeholder
property.label: Placeholder text for selection box
property.description: Set the placeholder text to appear in the Flow selection box

property.name: selectedFlowApiName
property.label: Store the API name of the selected Flow
property.description: On output this stores the API name of the selected Flow, and the component can be initialized with a value on input

property.name: showActiveFlowsOnly
property.label: Show Active Flows Only?
property.description: If set to True, only active Flows will be displayed

property.name: showWhichFlowTypes
property.label: Only show which Flow types? (default = Flow,AutolaunchedFlow)
property.description: Comma separated list of Flow Process Types to be included (see: https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_meta.meta/api_meta/meta_visual_workflow.htm)

property.name: required
property.label: Required?
property.description: If set to True, an error message will appear when trying to advance to the next screen. (default=False)

property.name: searchString
property.label: Flow Name Filter
property.description: Set a value to search and filter the returned list of Flows. This adds a LIKE %filtertext% to the Flow lookup.

property.name: componentWidth
property.label: Set component width (out of 12)
property.description: By dividing the full display area width into 12 equal sections, you can specify the percentage of the total width to be used by this component in 12ths. For example a value of 9 would be 75% width, 6 would be 50% width, 3 would be 25% width.

property.name: selectedFlowApiName
property.label: Store the API name of the selected Flow

property.name: showWhichFlowTypes
property.label: Only show which Flow types? (default = Flow,AutolaunchedFlow)
